function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Debate about the effectiveness of ventilation in reducing the transmission of SARS-CoV-2","Impact":"Potential confusion among the public and stakeholders, leading to inconsistent implementation of ventilation measures","Mitigation":"Clear communication and dissemination of evidence-based guidelines, ongoing research to provide more definitive conclusions","Technologies":"Improved ventilation systems, air filtration systems, air quality monitoring technology","People":"General public, businesses, schools, public health agencies, researchers","Owner":"Public health agencies, government bodies, research organizations"},{"Description":"Inconsistent understanding of the role of aerosol airborne transmission in the spread of SARS-CoV-2","Impact":"Uncertainty about appropriate control measures, potential for overlooking important transmission routes","Mitigation":"Further research and evidence gathering, collaboration between public health agencies and research institutions to reach consensus","Technologies":"Airborne virus sampling and analysis technology, aerosol control measures, indoor air quality monitoring systems","People":"Public health agencies, researchers, building owners, facility managers","Owner":"Public health agencies, research institutions, building owners"},{"Description":"Potential negligence in addressing airborne transmission risks due to conflicting expert opinions","Impact":"Increased risk of SARS-CoV-2 transmission in indoor environments, lack of standardized guidelines for ventilation and aerosol control","Mitigation":"Development of unified guidelines based on the most current evidence, stakeholder education and training on airborne transmission risks","Technologies":"Advanced air quality monitoring systems, ventilation efficiency modeling technology, aerosol containment and filtration systems","People":"Public health agencies, building owners, occupants of indoor environments","Owner":"Public health agencies, government bodies, research organizations"}]}
